text:
Hi everyone. I need to pass HubSpot property values to url parameters. The goals is to pass certain values to a survey platform… Is this the proper syntax to pass HubSpot data within a url…

`<https://companyurl.survey.com/jfe/form/SV_XXXXXXXXXXXXX?firstname={{personalization_token(>"contact.firstname")}}&group={{personalization_token("contact.group")}}`
I believe so, are you having issues with it?

Actually figured out that I just need this format in the url for the data to pass through, without the personalization_token stuff

`?firstname={{contact.firstname}};group={{contact.group}}`
Hi everyone! I would like to know if it is possible to have this google <https://developers.google.com/gmail/promotab/overview?hl=pt-br#microdata|feature> in emails.
Hi Everyone! Anyone know what to do about this error? Just bringing in HTML code from an email template in Klaviyo into HubSpot and can't hit save b/c of this error. The preview looks correct though.
Take <the stuff that HubSpot wants from you> and put it into something like <https://www.aliciaramirez.com/closing-tags-checker/> to make sure all the <table> <tr> and <td> tags are closed
says "congratulations no unclosed tags"
k then just paste that into HubSpot instead of the full klaviyo template
paste in the same code I put in the site above? tried that just now and getting the same error
without the html head and body tags?
sorry i'm not following
I'm brand new to all the HTML stuff so I'm trying to learn on the fly
OK, so what do I remove from the code I'm pulling from Klaviyo?
You want to copy everything from the line after `<body style="whatever">` to the line before `</body>`
ok that took care of the 2nd part of the error
still getting these closing tags are missing
hmmmm
See <https://parcel.io/blog/gmail-annotations>
Can you share the code you're pasting in HubSpot?
